column4: hello, is it possible to upgrade from 4.10 to the current stable version?
ah, online update?
no need to download cd?
hmm
only 1 cd: to install it :)
yes
yes?
apt-cdrom -d can do good things too
just type apt-cdrom for a summafy of the options
that was what i was checking over right now :)
says it cant open and "Permission denied" to my cd, should be because it's corrupt, right? cd's should have read access
apt-cdrom should be run as root iirc
hmm, it adds the cd in synaptic now but i see no new packages
sudo apt-cdrom -ad /media/cdrom1 add was what i did
it complains that no valid records were found
not without more info (like the exact error...)
that's the problem actually, it flys past and i can't see it
and what happens after that?
it just stops booting
so then you can write down the error I guess
i wish i could read an error log or something
it dumps the memory so the error leaves the screen, it's way behind
